title: Case Study: Temporomandibular Joint (TMJ) Disorder with Jaw and Ear Pain
clinical_history: A 35-year-old marketing executive, Sarah, presented with a 6-week history of jaw and ear pain. She reported that the pain started after a period of intense stress at work and a change in her diet to more hard and chewy foods. The pain is localized to her right jaw and ear, and she describes it as a dull ache that worsens throughout the day. She also experiences clicking and popping sounds in her jaw when she opens and closes her mouth.
aggrevating_factors: chewing, talking, yawning, eating hard or chewy foods, stress
picture: 24-hour pain pattern: pain is typically worse in the morning and evening, with some relief during meals
easing_factors: applying heat or cold packs to the affected area, massage, relaxation techniques
past_history: history of bruxism and teeth grinding at night
medical_history: generally healthy, but has a history of migraines
medications: ibuprofen as needed for pain relief
personal_history: married with two young children, works full-time, and has a high-stress job
imaging: X-rays of the TMJ showed joint space narrowing and degenerative changes
